intro: Illigera diptera, commonly known as the two-winged illigera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a delicate, feathery appearance. The species is notable for its unique pollination mechanism, involving small flies that are attracted to its scent and color.
